quote: ''When elected, my first act is to have the Freedom of Information Act (FOI) enacted into law. This is an important tool to promote public accountability.''

''The Constitution regards political dynasties as evil, because in effect they constitute a monopoly of political power inside a democracy, the Constitution of which explicitly provides that every qualified Filipino should have an equal opportunity for public service.''
''We will reform the 19-year old tax system, making it fairer, more responsive to changes in the economy, simpler to administer, and in sync with our ASEAN-5 competitors.''

No, unless amended to conform with the Constitution.
''The BBL seeks to establish a political entity so far unknown in the rest of constitutional democracies. While the Constitution takes care to define the limits of local autonomy, the BBL is vested with powers far beyond constitutional limits.''

''Yes, I am willing to join any move to declare independence from imposed sovereignty.
The West Philippine Sea dispute requires a second level of diplomacy as the other party takes keen interest in bilateral negotiation bordering on conciliation, relying apparently on the principles set forth in the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS), Part 15, Section 1.''

Yes for economic provisions.
Santiago’s platform includes amending the restrictive provisions in the Philippine Constitution, which have discouraged the entry of foreign investors into the country.
''There can be no true and meaningful democracy if we continue to systematically oppress the LGBT community and turn a blind eye the abuses committed against them.''

Yes, but improved to plug leakages.
''We will continue to support the Conditional Cash Transfer Program but we will plug the program's leakages. We will also reduce the cost of running the program by involving local authorities in implementing it.''
''My administration will end contractualization, which is an economic deprivation of life and security of person.''

''Kung talagang hindi sila magkasundo, bakit ko pipilitin?
I think that divorce should be available to people who become homicidal at the sight of each other.''

Yes, if the public approves.
''Why should we allow something de facto, such a fact, to disrupt the unity of the Filipino people? ....I will not, as an ordinary citizen, hold it against the community if the consensus by that time is to bury one of our former presidents [in the Libingan ng mga Bayani]. Why should we let a dead man control the actuations of the living and its new millennial generation? We should let go of the past.''
''My administration will place emphasis on effective use of land and resources.''

''It is still important to go over the details of martial law in the country so we will know what path we shall take for the millennials. I do not especially agree, and I beg the pardon of Mr. Marcos, that the details of martial law deserve to be buried and forgotten. No. On the contrary, the historians of tomorrow should make the study deeper so that we will know what lessons they held for our future.''

Yes, but eventually reduce labor export and deployment of OFWs by creating more jobs at home. Also, implement measures that seek to protect OFWs.
''All legal and diplomatic means must be exhausted to ensure that Filipinos abroad are not wrongfully deprived of life or liberty. But the ideal situation is one where remedy is not necessary. We must prevent these cases from happening.''
''I tell you this, once I become president of this country, all the people who stole the pork barrel amounting to billions of Philippine pesos shall be sent promptly to brand new jails.''
In a February 23, 2016 email to InterAksyon.com, the camp of Miriam Defensor Santiago said the senator 'has no stand' on the issue.

Yes, but with improved preparation.
''The widening classroom gap in the country is set to complicate the 17 implementation of the government?s K to 12 program, wherein the additional year in basic 18 education will result in a bigger student population in need of classrooms.''

''I am in favor of the CARP extension.... We really have to extend the CARP for the reason that it has failed in its objectives.... Ang pilosopiya ng CARP ay ibigay sa magsasaka  ang lupa mula mga nagmamay-ari ng lupaing agrikultural, para ang nagtatanim ay siya ring may-ari. Kabaligtaran ang nangyari dahil nakakita ang mga may-ari ng lupa ng loophole. Nag-apply sila for conversion ng lupa nila para hindi tawaging agricultural ang lupa nila para hindi mapasailalim sa CARP, at tawagin itong residential, commercial o industrial. Exempt na nga sila sa agrarian reform, kikita pa sila ng windfall profits.''
In a February 23, 2016 email to InterAksyon.com, the camp of Miriam Defensor Santiago said the senator 'has no stand' on the issue.

Yes, for humanitarian reasons.
''Obviously, the authorities just want to keep her under detention. She does not need the medical attention there or the facilities there. She's rich enough that she can buy it for herself.... Justice has been denied to her.''
In a February 23, 2016 email to InterAksyon.com, the camp of Miriam Defensor Santiago said the senator 'has no stand' on the issue.
